high.title: Connect with UBC International Student Community
high.description: Attend events organized by the UBC International Student Association to meet others experiencing similar challenges.
steps: Find upcoming events on the UBC website
Attend at least one event this week
Introduce yourself to at least three people

high.title: Virtual Family Connection
high.description: Schedule regular video calls with family and friends from home.
steps: Set a weekly call time that works across time zones
Share your experiences and listen to theirs
Create a shared digital photo album

high.title: Cultural Comfort Food
high.description: Find restaurants or learn to cook familiar dishes from your home country.
steps: Research local restaurants serving your cuisine
Learn one recipe from home each week
Host a small cultural dinner with new friends

high.title: Join a Cultural Student Association
high.description: UBC has many cultural and regional student associations where you can connect with students from your background.
steps: Check UBC Clubs Directory for your cultural association
Attend their next meeting
Volunteer for an upcoming cultural event

high.title: Talk to UBC International Student Advisor
high.description: UBC has dedicated advisors to help international students navigate homesickness and adjustment.
steps: Schedule an appointment with International Student Services
Prepare specific questions about your challenges
Follow their personalized suggestions

medium.title: Gratitude Journaling
medium.description: Write down three things you appreciate about your new environment daily.
steps: Get a dedicated notebook
Set a daily reminder
Reflect on positive aspects of your day before sleep

medium.title: Explore Vancouver
medium.description: Discover beautiful locations around Vancouver to create new positive memories.
steps: Visit Stanley Park
Explore Granville Island
Take photos of places that make you happy

medium.title: UBC Campus Resources
medium.description: Utilize UBC's counseling and wellness services designed for international students.
steps: Book an initial consultation with UBC Counseling
Attend a wellness workshop
Join a peer support group

medium.title: Regular Exercise Routine
medium.description: Physical activity can significantly improve mood and reduce homesickness feelings.
steps: Visit the UBC Aquatic Centre or gym
Join a recreational sports team
Try a new outdoor activity in Vancouver

medium.title: Mindfulness Meditation
medium.description: Practice being present to reduce anxiety about being far from home.
steps: Download a mindfulness app like Headspace
Start with 5-minute daily sessions
Attend a meditation class at UBC Wellness Centre

low.title: Create a Comfort Corner
low.description: Design a space in your room with familiar items from home.
steps: Add photos, souvenirs or decorations from home
Include sensory elements like familiar scents
Make it your go-to relaxation spot

low.title: Mindfulness Practice
low.description: Learn basic mindfulness techniques to stay grounded and present.
steps: Try a 5-minute guided meditation daily
Practice deep breathing when feeling overwhelmed
Use the UBC Wellness Centre resources

low.title: Join a Club or Activity
low.description: Find a club or activity that connects to your interests or culture.
steps: Browse UBC's club directory
Attend an introductory meeting
Participate regularly in one group activity

low.title: Local Buddy System
low.description: Connect with a domestic student through UBC's buddy programs.
steps: Apply for the UBC Peer Programs
Schedule regular meetups
Ask them to show you their favorite Vancouver spots

low.title: Nature Walks
low.description: Vancouver's natural beauty can be restorative and calming.
steps: Visit Pacific Spirit Regional Park near UBC
Walk along the seawall at sunset
Take photos to share with family
